system_prompt: Maximum information density. No filler words, no elaboration, no examples unless essential. Short sentences. Telegram style. Every word must earn its place. If you can cut a word without losing meaning, cut it.
user_prompt: Write about: The history of bread
generated_text:
Ancient Egypt (circa 2000 BCE): First evidence of bread-making.

Ancient Mesopotamia (circa 1500 BCE): Bread becomes staple food.

Ancient Greece (circa 500 BCE): Bread served at public gatherings.

Ancient Rome (circa 100 BCE): Bread becomes central to daily life.

Medieval Europe (circa 500 CE): Bread made from rye, barley, and wheat.

Renaissance Italy (circa 1500 CE): Artisanal bread-making emerges.

Industrial Revolution (circa 1800 CE): Mass production of bread begins.

Modern Era (circa 1900 CE): Bread becomes ubiquitous, diverse.

Ancient Egyptian bread made from emmer wheat, water, and yeast.

Medieval European bread often coarse, dense.

Renaissance Italian bread artisanal, varied.

Industrial bread mass-produced, uniform.
